ES.calibration_outcome: PARTIAL — FPR improved 27→19.2%, but M4 (FalseExec 20.4%) unchanged
ES.root_cause: M4 is NOT driven by pruning parameters. FalseExec is Sharp Boundary quality metric, independent of prune thresholds.

BTC.calibration_outcome: PARTIAL — FPR improved 29.7→22.1%, but M4 (FalseExec 14.9%) barely changed
BTC.root_cause: Same as ES. M4 failure is market-structural, not pruning-related.

engineering_analysis.key_discovery: FalseExec rate (M4) is independent of pruning parameters
explanation: Pruning controls WHICH trades get full orbit vs fast computation
FalseExec measures WHICH EXECUTE-classified trades actually lose
Sharp Boundary classification is stable regardless of pruning config
ES/BTC have structurally higher false execution profiles than NQ
engineering_analysis.conclusion: M4 threshold 10% is NQ-calibrated. ES/BTC need either (a) signal generation calibration, (b) market-specific M4 threshold, or (c) acceptance as market-structural difference.

options_forward.option_A: Calibrate signal generation parameters (ER_FLOOR, Z_NORM_THRESHOLD) per market → reduces false executions at source
options_forward.option_B: Accept market-specific M4 thresholds: NQ≤10%, ES≤25%, BTC≤20%
options_forward.option_C: Accept NQ-only deployment, defer ES/BTC to Phase 2
options_forward.recommended: Option C for v3_runtime_freeze. Option A as Phase 2 research.

v3_freeze_verdict.ES: DEFERRED — M4 structural, needs signal calibration or threshold adjustment
v3_freeze_verdict.BTC: DEFERRED — M4 structural, same root cause as ES
